channel.title: When I compile CFG files are not found
channel.description:
I'm using a mac and i compile and run through the terminal. It compiles fine but when it starts it cant find npc, npcdrops, autospawn, item, globaldrops, doors, or shops.cfg. New to coding so I'm not quite sure how to go about it, I'm guessing I have to change the directory somewhere to the correct locations but idk where I would change that at or why it isn't set to the right directory to begin with. Any help is much appreciated.
Using "iSkape's" source and client.

item.title: When I compile CFG files are not found
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“jeevelporse, post:13, topic:417064”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=519003.msg3772619#msg3772619 date=1317835493]
The cfg folder is named ‘cfg’ not as ‘CFG’ so that is case sensitive…
[/quote]

Ah, I see what you were getting at. However the mine is ‘config’ not ‘cfg’ and I have already went through and made sure that they’re correct. That was what I thought it was at first. It does this with some sources and not others so I’m starting to think Macs just suck.[/quote]

There is nothing wrong with a MAC besides being overpriced, but that is an entirely different argument. Your folders and file names are case sensitive, so look for where it loads one in the server, and make sure that it is named EXACTLY as it wants in the server. This includes extensions too

Read full topic

Ah, I see what you were getting at. However the mine is ‘config’ not ‘cfg’ and I have already went through and made sure that they’re correct. That was what I thought it was at first. It does this with some sources and not others so I’m starting to think Macs just suck.

item.title: When I compile CFG files are not found
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

post your compiler, usually this happens when your compiler cant find the directory that your .cfg files are, just re-direct your compiler to the correct directory.
